title: £509m investor: ‘We had to sell a supermarket because a Russian oligarch got involved’
text:
British investors have pulled billions out of Europe this year, as political instability in Italy and a potential recession in Germany have fuelled concerns. Despite this, European stock markets, outside of Britain, have risen almost 20pc.

Stephen Paice is one of the three managers running Baillie Gifford’s £509m European fund, which buys stocks in continental Europe and the Republic of Ireland. He says that, by ignoring Europe, investors risk missing out on some of the most entrepreneurial companies around the globe.

He tells Telegraph Money why he’s not scared of a recession and why Europe is the last place in the world you’d want to be invested in passively right now.

Who is the fund for?...
